newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq paper urges action against Kurds over water.
newsitem.headline: Iraq paper urges action against Kurds over water.

text.p: An official Iraqi newspaper urged the government on Saturday to take decisive action against rebel Iraqi Kurds for blocking the flow of water from two dams in northern Iraq.
"The response should be decisive toward such a deed which aims at killing the Iraqi man and destroying his economy," al-Iraq newspaper said in a front-page editorial.
"What is being carried out by a gang of traitors by cutting the flow of water...is something which one cannot remain silent about."

On Monday Iraq accused Kurdish rebels of the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) led by Jalal Talabani of cutting the flow from Dokan and Darbandikhan dams in northern Iraq, outside Iraqi government control since the 1991 Gulf War over Kuwait.

Iraq last September helped the Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP) led by Massoud Barzani oust rival rebels of the PUK from the city of Arbil. The move prompted the United States to fire missiles against Iraqi air defences in the south.

Baghdad has said the cutoff from the dams has caused severe shortages in Diyala (Ba'quba) province, 60 km (37 miles) northeast of Baghdad and the oil-rich Ta'meem (Kirkuk) province, 280 km (175 miles) north of Baghdad.
